abstract.p: Singer Engelbert Humperdinck, set to appear at State Theater in New Brunswick, NJ, releases dance-music album which includes remix of Release Me (S)

block.p: An old-fashioned crooner, sometimes referred to as Tom Jones-lite, Engelbert Humperdinck is perhaps a bit more hip than one might think. After all, Jimi Hendrix was his opening act in the 1960's and Elvis Presley's look -- the long sideburns and jumpsuit -- came from Mr. Humperdinck. Then there is his ability to fire up female fans, even if they are grandmothers now.
Mr. Humperdinck reinvented himself by appearing on MTV and by recording an unlikely, humorous track, ''Lesbian Seagull,'' for the 1996 ''Beavis and Butthead Do America'' soundtrack.

An old-fashioned crooner, sometimes referred to as Tom Jones-lite, Engelbert Humperdinck is perhaps a bit more hip than one might think. After all, Jimi Hendrix was his opening act in the 1960's and Elvis Presley's look -- the long sideburns and jumpsuit -- came from Mr. Humperdinck. Then there is his ability to fire up female fans, even if they are grandmothers now.
Mr. Humperdinck reinvented himself by appearing on MTV and by recording an unlikely, humorous track, ''Lesbian Seagull,'' for the 1996 ''Beavis and Butthead Do America'' soundtrack.

Mr. Humperdinck, who appears at the State Theater in New Brunswick on Thursday, recently released a dance-music album, which included an infectious remix of ''Release Me,'' which has been a hit in dance clubs, reaching the Billboard Dance Chart Top 10. Not bad for a square.
